JobFullDesc: Job SummaryThe HR Operations Analyst is an integral part of the HR team, responsible for owning design, configuration, management and maintenance of Workday, and administering HR policies to fulfill employment compliance requirements for Workiva. This role owns configuration for assigned areas and will partner cross-functionally to upgrade processes, deploy new functionality, or complete major system changes. The role also delivers reporting, analysis and project support to the HR team, integrating information and developing best practices to evolve global HR processes and reporting to ensure compliance and optimal efficiency. The HR Operations Analyst applies critical thinking to develop innovative solutions to maximize the effectiveness of the HR Operations team.ResponsibilitiesServes as technical point-of-contact and owner of Workday, including researching and resolving problems, unexpected results or process flaws; performing scheduled activities; and clearly communicating system changes, updates, and enhancements.Obtains requirements from subject matter experts within HR and other parts of the business. Translates business needs into functional and technical requirements. Implements solutions and coordinates and leads activities related to project work plans.Completes configuration testing and necessary governance processes prior to moving changes into production.Owns configuration of assigned Workday modules, yet operates with a keen understanding of the overall system architecture. Provides advice and input across all configuration areas for the team.Create and maintain Workday documentation including user guides, training manuals, and operating manuals.Responsible for educating internal staff on functionalities and new features within the system.Maintain data accuracy and integrity within systems through regular review and audit of data.Manage permissions, access, personalization and system operations and settings for Workday users.Work with implementation partners for necessary technical support.Provides analytic observations and development of Workday reports, dashboards, and scorecards on HR metrics to assist in assessing the effectiveness of talent management practices, including: recruiting, employee relations, performance management, retention, turnover, talent management, mobility, career progression.Ensures data quality and integrity by performing regular maintenance and system audits.Maintains proper policies and records, and executes
